content.question: Two identical objects, X and Y, move toward each other at different speeds on a horizontal surface with negligible friction, as shown in the top figure. The objects then collide elastically and move away from each other. The kinetic energy of object X as a function of time is shown in the graph. Which of the following is true of the speed <math alttext="v sub Y" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub></math> of object Y?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub Y" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub></math> after the collision is greater than it was before the collision.
<math alttext="v sub Y" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub></math> after the collision is equal to what it was before the collision.
<math alttext="v sub Y" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub></math> after the collision is less than it was before the collision.
<math alttext="v sub Y" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub></math> after the collision cannot be compared to what it was before the collision without knowing the mass of the objects.

content.answer: <math alttext="v sub Y" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub></math> after the collision is greater than it was before the collision.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
